2022-03-27T18:58:53Z: And that's all from us! Thanks so much for joining us this evening - we'll be back in a couple of weeks for the Australian GP! See you then.
2022-03-27T18:56:24Z:
Here's the report from a thrilling battle for victory in Saudi Arabia: 
https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-saudi-arabian-gp-race-report/9375452/
2022-03-27T18:51:43Z: F1 hasn't visited Albert Park since, you know, the last time. Where all the stuff happened. Let's hope that, when F1 returns to Australia, none of that happens again.
2022-03-27T18:46:35Z: We're only two races in, but it looks as though the Leclerc and Verstappen battle is hotting up as our main title fight - can battle be joined by Sainz, Perez, or perhaps a third party? Australia's next up in two weeks' time - for the first time since 2019.
2022-03-27T18:40:21Z: Replay of a thumbs-up from Leclerc to Verstappen at the finish - it looks like the two really enjoyed that fight. Sainz joins them on the podium, albeit awaiting whatever call's made on the yellow flags.
2022-03-27T18:33:47Z: Now, we've got investigations for Magnussen, Sainz and Perez for apparently failing to slow properly for yellow flags.
2022-03-27T18:31:27Z: Zhou misses out on points in 11th, beating the two Aston Martins home. Just 13 finishers in this race.
2022-03-27T18:30:46Z: Gasly gets eighth place, Magnussen takes ninth, and Hamilton rescues a point in 10th place.
2022-03-27T18:30:03Z: What a battle! Sainz finishes third, Perez fourth, Russell fifth, and Ocon JUST holds off from Norris for sixth place!
2022-03-27T18:29:01Z: Half a second! Max Verstappen wins the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix, half a second ahead of Charles Leclerc!
2022-03-27T18:27:38Z: Leclerc has DRS as the final lap begins, but he's too far behind to make the move. He's running out of chances to get the lead back from Verstappen...
2022-03-27T18:27:28Z: Stroll vs Albon will be investigated by the stewards after the race. Stroll has damage and has dropped to 13th and last place.
2022-03-27T18:26:39Z: Stroll and Albon have come together at Turn 1 which caused those yellow flags. Albon sticks it up the inside but the door gets shut and the pair clash. Albon has pulled to the side of the track and won't finish the race.
2022-03-27T18:26:17Z: At the worst moment, there's a yellow flag at Turn 1, which meant Leclerc didn't have DRS! Verstappen was just half a second up the road, so hangs on to the lead.
2022-03-27T18:24:55Z: Does Leclerc have anything in his locker in this final three laps? He's not letting this go...
2022-03-27T18:24:28Z: Unless something wild happens, there won't be enough laps left for Magnussen and Hamilton to climb any higher than ninth and 10th respectively.
2022-03-27T18:23:55Z: And with free air, Verstappen punches in a 1m31.779s - four tenths faster than Leclerc - to cement a very handy advantage.
2022-03-27T18:23:08Z: And the lead is Verstappen's! He tees up the move perfectly into Turn 27 and sits right behind the Ferrari, drafting past Leclerc and takes the lead with four laps remaining!
2022-03-27T18:21:42Z: Leclerc has a slight snap of understeer into Turn 27, Verstappen gets a very good run with DRS, but Leclerc hangs on - albeit under a LOT of pressure.
2022-03-27T18:21:30Z: Stroll can't keep Hamilton back, who is now up to 10th place and chasing after Magnussen again.
2022-03-27T18:20:23Z: Strong defending from Stroll on the inside at Turn 2 to close the door on Hamilton. Can he hold him back for another five laps to keep the final points position?
2022-03-27T18:18:58Z: Magnussen makes quick work of passing Stroll to take ninth on his fresh mediums, as Hamilton does the same to Albon to take 11th place. Those two will be on an almighty charge up the order over the final six laps.
2022-03-27T18:18:43Z: Leclerc AND Verstappen both get on the anchors for Turn 27, neither wanting to be ahead for the DRS zone! Leclerc gets on the throttle sooner and goes for it, holding the lead still! Great tactics at play.
2022-03-27T18:16:59Z: Verstappen gets the move done ahead of Turn 27, and takes the lead! Leclerc will have DRS, can he get him back? He does, diving past into Turn 1!
2022-03-27T18:16:07Z: Magnussen has got ahead of Albon to claim 10th place, Hamilton is right behind the pair of them in 12th.
2022-03-27T18:15:16Z: Verstappen's right on Leclerc's tail now, he has a good run into Turn 1 but Leclerc manages to hold on! The Ferrari hasn't seemed to have fired up its tyres!
2022-03-27T18:14:23Z: Hamilton duly pits, binning off his hard tyres for fresh mediums. That'll be a long drop down the order for the Mercedes driver, who comes out behind Magnussen.
2022-03-27T18:13:33Z: Alonso's Alpine has been pushed behind the barriers at pit entry. Just 14 cars left in this race.
2022-03-27T18:13:03Z: The track is clear - and we're racing once more.
2022-03-27T18:11:05Z: Ricciardo's McLaren is pushed into the pitlane by the marshals, who now rush back to retrieve Alonso's Alpine which stopped in the same part of the track.
2022-03-27T18:09:20Z: It is too late for Hamilton, who missed the time to pit before the pitlane was closed.
2022-03-27T18:08:53Z: The pitlane entry is now closed - was that the case when Magnussen and Hulkenberg came in?
2022-03-27T18:08:32Z: Magnussen and Hulkenberg pit with a safety car period threatening due to Ricciardo and Alonso stopped on track.
2022-03-27T18:06:23Z: Alonso's dash says 'cool the car' and he is limping around the track at 70mph. And now Ricciardo has come to a crawl!
2022-03-27T18:05:12Z: Alonso has an issue! He gets overtaken by Magnussen at Turn 1 and is slow coming out of Turn 2.
2022-03-27T18:04:16Z: The leading duo is still managing to match each other, both post 1m32.4s laps that time around, the 35th lap of the day. 15 laps remain.
2022-03-27T18:03:09Z: Alonso is the one looking for a move now, sizing up Magnussen on the run to the final corner. With the DRS boost Alonso gets around the outside of Magnussen at Turn 1 to take seventh place.
2022-03-27T18:00:20Z: Bottas is sniffing for a way past Alonso for eighth place. The Finn is within DRS range but, so far, hasn't attempted a move. Both are also catching Magnussen ahead who is yet to pit.
2022-03-27T17:59:22Z: Having watched Verstappen chip away at his lead a little bit, Leclerc has set a 1m32.683s to open the gap up to 1.5s by the end of lap 32.
2022-03-27T17:55:47Z: No further investigation for the Sainz/Perez safety car line incident - as Perez wisely gave up third place.
2022-03-27T17:54:01Z: On lap 29 Gasly also gets by Hulkenberg, you guessed it with the aid of DRS at Turn 1, to take 13th place.
2022-03-27T17:53:11Z: And indeed, it's a 1m32.711s for Leclerc - he's trading fastest laps with Verstappen as they fight for victory.
2022-03-27T17:52:40Z: And Norris duly gets by the Aston Martin driver with the aid of DRS into Turn 1 for 12th place. It can't be fun this for Hulkenberg on his very old hards.
2022-03-27T17:52:25Z: Verstappen responds with a 1m33.059s to close back in on Leclerc, but the leader is currently retaliating on this tour around the track. Sainz lost time due to a missed shift on lap 27.
2022-03-27T17:51:21Z: Hulkenberg loses another place, this time to Ricciardo, so is back to 12th place with Norris now right behind him.
2022-03-27T17:50:44Z: Sainz, meanwhile, has set a 1m33.181s on lap 26 to set the fastest lap, in his bid to close back in on Verstappen.
2022-03-27T17:50:35Z: Zhou is duly given a drive through penalty for not serving his original penalty. What a nightmare for the F1 rookie.
2022-03-27T17:49:34Z: Verstappen reports that Leclerc crossed the pit entry line, which you're not allowed to do unless you're pitting. We'll see if anything happens there.
2022-03-27T17:49:20Z: Zhou really isn't having a good day. He is under investigation for not serving his five-second time penalty, it looks like that pitstop issue might have led to him not being stationary and untouched by his pitcrew for the full time.
2022-03-27T17:48:06Z: A lap later Hulkenberg loses another place, this time to Ocon, and duly drops to 11th.
2022-03-27T17:47:53Z: Verstappen punches in a 1m33.445s to close in on Leclerc a little bit as we reach half-distance. Meanwhile, Hamilton now puts a move on Magnussen with DRS and makes it stick.
2022-03-27T17:46:58Z: Bottas, with the aid of DRS at Turn 1, gets by Hulkenberg  for ninth place. Hulkenberg is the cork in the midfield bottle on his older hard tyres.
2022-03-27T17:45:57Z: Hamilton dispatches Magnussen for sixth ahead of Turn 27, but the Haas driver comes back at him with DRS and reclaims the position into Turn 1!
2022-03-27T17:44:15Z: It's a 1m34.075s on that lap for Leclerc, denying Verstappen DRS at the start of lap 23.
2022-03-27T17:44:12Z: The DRS has been enabled so the overtakes may now follow after a relatively tame restart.
2022-03-27T17:43:33Z: Leclerc was not going to respond to Verstappen's jockeying at the restart, guiding the Red Bull driver to the marbles before taking off.
2022-03-27T17:42:29Z: Magnussen is in a Mercedes sandwich at the restart but holds station in sixth place for now.
2022-03-27T17:42:16Z: Leclerc holds on from Verstappen, and Perez gave up the place to Sainz there - so it's Ferrari, Red Bull, Ferrari, Red Bull.
2022-03-27T17:37:59Z: The safety car is in this lap. Here we go.
2022-03-27T17:36:13Z: And indeed, the Sainz/Perez moment has been noted for a safety car infringement. Perez may have to give that back.
2022-03-27T17:35:32Z: Sainz is unhappy with Perez, whom he says pushed him off despite the Ferrari driver apparently being ahead at the pit exit line. The stewards will undoubtedly get involved here.
2022-03-27T17:35:28Z: Zhou not having the best race so far. He serves the five-second time penalty during his pitstop under the safety car but loses further time when the car comes off the front jack and needs lifting up by a second jack. He is currently in 15th place.
2022-03-27T17:34:22Z: With the flurry of safety car pitstops, Magnussen and Hamilton on the hard tyres stayed out and occupy sixth and seventh.
2022-03-27T17:32:45Z: Latifi appeared to grab a fistful of oversteer when getting on the power out of the final corner and trying to correct it he clatters into the wall. The Williams driver is OK and out of the car which is now being picked up by a recovery tractor.
2022-03-27T17:31:01Z: It is now a full safety car rather than a virtual one.
2022-03-27T17:30:09Z: That's inexplicably worked wonders for Ferrari as a result - Leclerc and Sainz get very 'cheap' pitstops now, as does Verstappen who also peels in.
2022-03-27T17:28:52Z: Latifi has crashed! Virtual Safety Car deployed!
2022-03-27T17:28:14Z: Stroll and Albon also pit early from the midfield and duly cycle back to the rear of the field. Still all 18 runners going who started this race.
2022-03-27T17:27:01Z: Hamilton makes quick work of overtaking Gasly for 10th place with the help of DRS along the main straight.
2022-03-27T17:26:07Z: No further investigation from the FIA stewards on the Alonso vs Ocon battle.
2022-03-27T17:24:02Z: Zhou has been given a five-second time penalty for leaving the track and gaining an advantage from his battle with Albon.
2022-03-27T17:23:19Z: Ocon has another go at Alonso there, but once again finds his way into the Turn 1 run-off as he overdoes it with DRS. The Alpines have cleared Bottas a bit now, but the battle might bring the Alfa driver back into play.
2022-03-27T17:23:16Z: Hamilton gets by Norris at the final corner to take 11th place. He now has a three-second gap to bridge to catch Gasly.
2022-03-27T17:22:34Z: Ricciardo has pitted early, switching his mediums for hards, so cycles to the back of the pack.
2022-03-27T17:22:33Z: Leclerc's been able to extend his gap over Verstappen to 2.1s, as Perez is keeping a stable gap over the Ferrari driver out in front.
2022-03-27T17:21:55Z: The Zhou vs Albon Turn 2 fight has been put under investigation by the FIA stewards.
2022-03-27T17:21:05Z: Magnussen wants to join the fight further forward and tries to go around the outside of Bottas at Turn 1 but overcooks it and clatters over the kerbs at Turn 2 to hand the place back.
2022-03-27T17:19:56Z: Hamilton, on the hards remember, gets ahead of Stroll to move up to 12th place. The less good news for him is he's already 32s off leader Perez 10 laps into this race.
2022-03-27T17:17:38Z: The FIA stewards are taking full use of their notepads, as both the Alonso vs Ocon Turn 1 battle and a Zhou vs Albon Turn 2 fight have been noted.
2022-03-27T17:16:51Z: Ocon has a go at returning the favour against Alonso, grabbing DRS but goes far too deep into Turn 1 and takes to the run-off. He'll have to give it back, but with caution as Bottas is lurking behind them.
2022-03-27T17:15:43Z: Both Williams really struggling for pace as Albon drops behind Hulkenberg into 17th place, which means both the Grove team cars are at the back of the pack.
2022-03-27T17:14:56Z: Alonso finally makes the move on Ocon, blasting past with DRS and wrestling against his team-mate for sixth place. Ocon didn't want to give it up, as Alonso took the inside line for Turn 2.
2022-03-27T17:14:13Z: As of lap 7, Perez has 2.4s over Leclerc, who has 1.3s over Verstappen. Sainz has fallen back a little bit now.
2022-03-27T17:13:20Z: Ocon's continuing to defend against Alonso, who's looking much quicker than the leading Alpine. Will a switcheroo be imminent among the pink cars? We'll keep an eye out.
2022-03-27T17:12:23Z: Despite locking up at Turn 1 a lap earlier, Zhou is making good progress through the field and is back up to 15th having got by Albon and Hulkenberg in quick succession.
2022-03-27T17:11:31Z: Crikey! Alonso tries a move on Ocon but the French driver shows his Alpine driver the door into Turn 1 - that nearly came to blows!
2022-03-27T17:11:14Z: Gasly gets back by Norris at the final corner on lap four to reclaim 10th place.
2022-03-27T17:09:59Z: Meanwhile, Russell stuffs his car down the inside of Ocon at Turn 27 and makes the move for fifth! He still has DRS, and keeps ahead into the first corner.
2022-03-27T17:09:27Z: A Turn 4 incident between Norris and Magnussen has been noted by the race stewards.
2022-03-27T17:09:14Z: Perez is beginning to flex an advantage out in front, setting a 1m34.596s on the third lap to go 0.2s faster than Leclerc. Small margins, but they add up!
2022-03-27T17:07:05Z: Perez begins lap 2 with 1.2s over Leclerc, with Verstappen a further second behind. Sainz is not letting go of Verstappen, as the pair has now dropped Ocon and Russell.
2022-03-27T17:06:48Z: Shocker of a start by Zhou who is down in last place after getting boxed in at Turn 1! Further ahead Norris gets ahead of Gasly at Turn 1 on the second lap to move up to 10th.
2022-03-27T17:05:12Z: Magnussen makes the best start of the midfield runners by moving up to ninth place ahead of Gasly in the first few corners.
2022-03-27T17:05:02Z: Perez covers off Leclerc at the start, as Verstappen dispatches Sainz into Turn 1! Sainz hangs on, as Ocon's looking to buy into the battle for third too!
2022-03-27T17:04:18Z: Lights off, let's rock - the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix is away!
2022-03-27T17:03:20Z: The cars are lining up - are you ready? Then let's begin.
2022-03-27T17:01:11Z: Tyre news: all on mediums, except Magnussen, Hamilton and Hulkenberg, who begin on the hard compound.
2022-03-27T17:00:40Z: The F1 grid graphics show Sainz heading for a pitlane start - but that's not correct. The formation lap begins.
2022-03-27T16:58:03Z: Shower thought: why hasn't a yoghurt company ever bought the naming rights to an F1 circuit turn? Think of the advertising potential of Muller Corner...
2022-03-27T16:54:10Z: Not long to go now - hope you're sitting comfortably. Or standing comfortably. We're not going to tell you how to live your lives.
2022-03-27T16:49:28Z: Magnussen struggled with his neck towards the end of qualifying yesterday - it appears to be strapped up as he gets on board his car, so it'll be a difficult day for the Dane.
2022-03-27T16:47:52Z: You'll be pleased to know that there's a 0% risk of rain for this race. Rain in Saudi? Not even cloudy.
2022-03-27T16:46:25Z: Thought we'd magnanimously let that joke hang for a bit - and now, we move on with 15 minutes to go. Just 18 drivers left for the start, the last row populated entirely by drivers called Nic(h)olas.
2022-03-27T16:35:25Z: 25 minutes until lights out on the Jeddah Corniche Circuit. Perez and Leclerc, Sainz and Verstappen, and Ocon and Russell flank the opening three rows. Tantalising stuff for this 50-lap race.
2022-03-27T16:30:59Z: It's been a hugely difficult weekend for Tsunoda - apparent powertrain problems stopped him setting a lap in qualifying, and now they've stopped him before the race could begin.
2022-03-27T16:26:29Z: Ferrari has reported that Sainz was having to contend with a wiring loom issue - but as one car gets fixed, one encounters trouble. Tsunoda's parked up in a run-off zone, having apparently lost the engine - absolute nightmare.
2022-03-27T16:24:19Z: Sainz is out of the garage and doing a reconnaissance lap now, so it seems Ferrari has done its work. We'll continue to keep an eye out.
2022-03-27T16:08:56Z: There's been some work down at Sainz's side of the Ferrari garage, so hopefully they'll fix whatever looked iffy and get the Spanish driver to the grid.
2022-03-27T16:07:21Z: There's a couple of changes to the grid from yesterday's qualifying order: Daniel Ricciardo was handed a three-place grid penalty and starts 14th, as Mick Schumacher will not start the race following his hefty shunt in Q2 yesterday. Luckily, Schumacher is uninjured and well - Haas is saving parts for Australia.
2022-03-27T16:04:23Z: A reminder of yesterday: Sergio Perez starts from pole, after just beating Charles Leclerc to top spot in last night's Q3 session. Carlos Sainz Jr and Max Verstappen begin on row two. Lewis Hamilton was knocked out in Q1, following struggles with set-up yesterday.
2022-03-27T16:01:31Z: Good evening everyone - and welcome to our Autosport Live coverage of the second round of the 2022 Formula 1 season - the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix. One hour until the race kicks off at the Jeddah Corniche Circuit, so plenty of time to settle in and saddle up.
